intro: Silene montbretiana var. montbretiana, commonly known as the Alpine campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly the Alps, and thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant produces striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Silene montbretiana var. montbretiana is often found in open habitats like meadows and scree slopes at high altitudes.
